S

SendData - Class in com.willblaschko.android.alexa.sender
An abstract class that supplies a DataOutputStream which is used to send a POST request to the AVS server with a voice data intent, it handles the response with completePost() (called by extending classes)
SendData() - Constructor for class com.willblaschko.android.alexa.sender.SendData
 
SendText - Class in com.willblaschko.android.alexa.sender
A subclass of SendData that allows an arbitrary text string to be sent to the AVS servers, translated through Google's text to speech engine This speech is rendered using the VoiceHelper utility class, and is done on whatever thread this call is running
SendText() - Constructor for class com.willblaschko.android.alexa.sender.SendText
 
sendText(Context, String, String, String, AsyncCallback<AvsResponse, Exception>) - Method in class com.willblaschko.android.alexa.sender.SendText
Use VoiceHelper utility to create an audio file from arbitrary text using Text-To-Speech to be passed to the AVS servers
sendTextRequest(int, String, AsyncCallback<List<AvsItem>, Exception>) - Method in class com.willblaschko.android.alexa.AlexaManager
Send a text string request to the AVS server, this is run through Text-To-Speech to create the raw audio file needed by the AVS server.
SendVoice - Class in com.willblaschko.android.alexa.sender
A subclass of SendData that sends a recorded raw audio to the AVS server, unlike SendText, this does not use an intermediary steps, but the starting/stopping need to be handled manually or programmatically, which Google's voice offering already does automatically (listens for speech thresholds).
SendVoice() - Constructor for class com.willblaschko.android.alexa.sender.SendVoice
 
showAuthToast(Context, String) - Static method in class com.willblaschko.android.alexa.Util
Show an authorization toast on the main thread to make sure the user sees it
start() - Method in interface com.willblaschko.android.alexa.callbacks.AsyncCallback
 
start() - Method in class com.willblaschko.android.alexa.callbacks.ImplAsyncCallback
 
startRecording(int, AsyncCallback<Void, Exception>) - Method in class com.willblaschko.android.alexa.AlexaManager
 
startRecording(int, String, AsyncCallback<Void, Exception>) - Method in class com.willblaschko.android.alexa.AlexaManager
 
startRecording(int, byte[], AsyncCallback<Void, Exception>) - Method in class com.willblaschko.android.alexa.AlexaManager
Paired with stopRecording()--these need to be triggered manually or programmatically as a pair.
startRecording(Context, String, String, byte[], AsyncCallback<Void, Exception>) - Method in class com.willblaschko.android.alexa.sender.SendVoice
The trigger to open a new AudioRecord and start recording with the intention of sending the audio to the AVS server using the stopRecord().
stop() - Method in class com.willblaschko.android.alexa.avs.AlexaAudioPlayer
A helper function to stop the MediaPlayer
stopRecording(AsyncCallback<List<AvsItem>, Exception>) - Method in class com.willblaschko.android.alexa.AlexaManager
Paired with startRecording()--these need to be triggered manually or programmatically as a pair.
stopRecording() - Method in class com.willblaschko.android.alexa.sender.SendVoice
Stop recording the user's audio and send the request to the AVS server, parse the response
success(D) - Method in interface com.willblaschko.android.alexa.callbacks.AsyncCallback
 
success(D) - Method in class com.willblaschko.android.alexa.callbacks.ImplAsyncCallback
